name: cloudflare
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing Cloudflare cloud resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`cloudflare` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/cloudflare/terraform-provider-cloudflare).

accountId.description:
Configure API client to always use a specific account. Alternatively, can be configured using the
`CLOUDFLARE_ACCOUNT_ID` environment variable.

apiBasePath.description:
Configure the base path used by the API client. Alternatively, can be configured using the `CLOUDFLARE_API_BASE_PATH`
environment variable.

apiClientLogging.description:
Whether to print logs from the API client (using the default log library logger). Alternatively, can be configured using
the `CLOUDFLARE_API_CLIENT_LOGGING` environment variable.

apiHostname.description:
Configure the hostname used by the API client. Alternatively, can be configured using the `CLOUDFLARE_API_HOSTNAME`
environment variable.

apiKey.description: The API key for operations. Alternatively, can be configured using the `CLOUDFLARE_API_KEY` environment variable.

apiToken.description: The API Token for operations. Alternatively, can be configured using the `CLOUDFLARE_API_TOKEN` environment variable.

apiUserServiceKey.description:
A special Cloudflare API key good for a restricted set of endpoints. Alternatively, can be configured using the
`CLOUDFLARE_API_USER_SERVICE_KEY` environment variable.

email.description:
A registered Cloudflare email address. Alternatively, can be configured using the `CLOUDFLARE_EMAIL` environment
variable.

maxBackoff.description:
Maximum backoff period in seconds after failed API calls. Alternatively, can be configured using the
`CLOUDFLARE_MAX_BACKOFF` environment variable.

minBackoff.description:
Minimum backoff period in seconds after failed API calls. Alternatively, can be configured using the
`CLOUDFLARE_MIN_BACKOFF` environment variable.

retries.description:
Maximum number of retries to perform when an API request fails. Alternatively, can be configured using the
`CLOUDFLARE_RETRIES` environment variable.

rps.description:
RPS limit to apply when making calls to the API. Alternatively, can be configured using the `CLOUDFLARE_RPS` environment
variable.

customCertificate.description: If a custom uploaded certificate is used.

customKey.description: The key for a custom uploaded certificate.

method.description:
Domain control validation (DCV) method used for this
hostname. Valid values are `"txt"`, `"http"` and `"email"`.

settings.description: SSL/TLS settings for the certificate. See further notes below.

type.description: Level of validation to be used for this hostname. Domain validation ("dv") must be used.

wildcard.description: Indicates whether the certificate covers a wildcard.

ciphers.description: List of SSL/TLS ciphers to associate with this certificate.

earlyHints.description: Whether or not early hints should be supported. Valid values are `"on"` or `"off"`.

http2.description: Whether or not HTTP2 should be supported. Valid values are `"on"` or `"off"`.

minTlsVersion.description:
Lowest version of TLS this certificate should
support. Valid values are `"1.0"`, `"1.1"`, `"1.2"` and `"1.3"`.

tls13.description: Whether or not TLSv1.3 should be supported. Valid values are `"on"` or `"off"`.

bundleMethod.description: Method of building intermediate certificate chain. A ubiquitous bundle has the highest probability of being verified everywhere, even by clients using outdated or unusual trust stores. An optimal bundle uses the shortest chain and newest intermediates. And the force bundle verifies the chain, but does not otherwise modify it. Valid values are `ubiquitous` (default), `optimal`, `force`.

geoRestrictions.description: Specifies the region where your private key can be held locally. Valid values are `us`, `eu`, `highest_security`.

type.description: Whether to enable support for legacy clients which do not include SNI in the TLS handshake. Valid values are `legacy_custom` (default), `sni_custom`.

clientId.description: The client identifier for authenticating API calls.

clientKey.description: The client key for authenticating API calls.

clientSecret.description: The client secret for authenticating API calls.

customerId.description: The customer identifier for authenticating API calls.

domain.description: = (Required) The domain that the client must join.

enabled.description: = (Required) True if the firewall must be enabled.

exists.description: Checks if the file should exist.

requireAll.description: = (Required) True if all drives must be encrypted.

running.description: Checks if the application should be running.

sha256.description: The sha256 hash of the file.

thumbprint.description: The thumbprint of the application certificate.

platform.description: The platform of the device. Valid values are `windows`, `mac`, `linux`, `android`, and `ios`.

description.description: The description of the domain.

dnsServers.description: The DNS servers to receive the redirected request.

suffix.description: The domain to ignore DNS requests.

comment.description: A note that can be used to annotate the item.

value.description: The IPv4 address, IPv4 CIDR or IPv6 CIDR. IPv6 CIDRs are limited to a maximum of /64.

values.description: A list of string values for the header.

sessionPercent.description: Percent of session traffic to shed 0 - 100.

sessionPolicy.description: Method of shedding session traffic "" or "hash".

address.description: The IP address (IPv4 or IPv6) of the origin, or the publicly addressable hostname. Hostnames entered here should resolve directly to the origin, and not be a hostname proxied by Cloudflare.

enabled.description: Whether to enable (the default) this origin within the Pool. Disabled origins will not receive traffic and are excluded from health checks. The origin will only be disabled for the current pool.

name.description: A human-identifiable name for the origin.

weight.description: The weight (0.01 - 1.00) of this origin, relative to other origins in the pool. Equal values mean equal weighting. A weight of 0 means traffic will not be sent to this origin, but health is still checked. Default: 1.

values.description: A list of string values for the header.

poolIds.description: A list of pool IDs in failover priority to use for traffic reaching the given PoP.

pop.description: A 3-letter code for the Point-of-Presence. Allowed values can be found in the list of datacenters on the [status page](https://www.cloudflarestatus.com/). Multiple entries should not be specified with the same PoP.

poolIds.description: A list of pool IDs in failover priority to use for traffic reaching the given PoP.

region.description: A region code which must be in the list defined [here](https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/en-us/articles/115000540888-Load-Balancing-Geographic-Regions). Multiple entries should not be specified with the same region.

condition.description: The statement to evaluate to determine if this rules effects should be applied. An empty condition is always true. See [load balancing rules](https://developers.cloudflare.com/load-balancing/understand-basics/load-balancing-rules).

disabled.description: A disabled rule will be be executed.

fixedResponse.description: Settings for a HTTP response to return directly to the eyeball if the condition is true. Note: overrides or fixed_response must be set. See the field documentation below.

name.description: Human readable name for this rule.

overrides.description: The Load Balancer settings to alter if this rules condition is true. Note: overrides or fixed_response must be set. See the field documentation below.

priority.description: Priority used when determining the order of rule execution. Lower values are executed first. If not provided list order will be used.

terminates.description: Terminates indicates that if this rule is true no further rules should be executed. Note: setting a fixed_response forces this field to true.

contentType.description: The value of the HTTP context-type header for this fixed response.

location.description: The value of the HTTP location header for this fixed response.

messageBody.description: The text used as the html body for this fixed response.

statusCode.description: The HTTP status code used for this fixed response.

poolIds.description: A list of pool IDs in failover priority to use for traffic reaching the given PoP.

pop.description: A 3-letter code for the Point-of-Presence. Allowed values can be found in the list of datacenters on the [status page](https://www.cloudflarestatus.com/). Multiple entries should not be specified with the same PoP.

poolIds.description: A list of pool IDs in failover priority to use for traffic reaching the given PoP.

region.description: A region code which must be in the list defined [here](https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/en-us/articles/115000540888-Load-Balancing-Geographic-Regions). Multiple entries should not be specified with the same region.

name.description: The name of the notification policy.

enableds.description: State of the pool to alert on. Example: `"true"`, `"false"`.

name.description: The name of the notification policy.
The name of the notification policy.

alwaysUseHttps.description: Boolean of whether this action is enabled. Default: false.

browserCacheTtl.description: The Time To Live for the browser cache. `0` means 'Respect Existing Headers'

bypassCacheOnCookie.description: String value of cookie name to conditionally bypass cache the page.

cacheKeyFields.description: Controls how Cloudflare creates Cache Keys used to identify files in cache. See below for full description.

cacheLevel.description: Whether to set the cache level to `"bypass"`, `"basic"`, `"simplified"`, `"aggressive"`, or `"cache_everything"`.

cacheOnCookie.description: String value of cookie name to conditionally cache the page.

cacheTtlByStatuses.description: Set cache TTL based on the response status from the origin web server. Can be specified multiple times. See below for full description.

disableApps.description: Boolean of whether this action is enabled. Default: false.

disablePerformance.description: Boolean of whether this action is enabled. Default: false.

disableRailgun.description: Boolean of whether this action is enabled. Default: false.

disableSecurity.description: Boolean of whether this action is enabled. Default: false.

disableZaraz.description: Boolean of whether this action is enabled. Default: false.

edgeCacheTtl.description: The Time To Live for the edge cache.

explicitCacheControl.description: Whether origin Cache-Control action is `"on"` or `"off"`.

forwardingUrl.description: The URL to forward to, and with what status. See below.

hostHeaderOverride.description: Value of the Host header to send.

minifies.description: The configuration for HTML, CSS and JS minification. See below for full list of options.

rocketLoader.description: Whether to set the rocket loader to `"on"`, `"off"`.

securityLevel.description: Whether to set the security level to `"off"`, `"essentially_off"`, `"low"`, `"medium"`, `"high"`, or `"under_attack"`.

ssl.description: Whether to set the SSL mode to `"off"`, `"flexible"`, `"full"`, `"strict"`, or `"origin_pull"`.

cookie.description: Controls what cookies go into Cache Key:

header.description: Controls what HTTP headers go into Cache Key:

host.description: Controls which Host header goes into Cache Key:

queryString.description: Controls which URL query string parameters go into the Cache Key.

user.description: Controls which end user-related features go into the Cache Key.

checkPresences.description: Check for presence of specified HTTP headers, without including their actual values.

includes.description: Only use values of specified query string parameters in Cache Key.

checkPresences.description: Check for presence of specified HTTP headers, without including their actual values.

excludes.description: Exclude these query string parameters from Cache Key.

includes.description: Only use values of specified query string parameters in Cache Key.

resolved.description: `false` (default) - includes the Host header in the HTTP request sent to the origin; `true` - includes the Host header that was resolved to get the origin IP for the request (e.g. changed with Resolve Override Page Rule).

excludes.description: Exclude these query string parameters from Cache Key.

ignore.description: `false` (default) - all query string parameters are used for Cache Key, unless explicitly excluded; `true` - all query string parameters are ignored; value should be `false` if any of `exclude` or `include` is non-empty.

includes.description: Only use values of specified query string parameters in Cache Key.

deviceType.description: `true` - classifies a request as mobile, desktop, or tablet based on the User Agent; defaults to `false`.

geo.description: `true` - includes the clients country, derived from the IP address; defaults to `false`.

lang.description: `true` - includes the first language code contained in the `Accept-Language` header sent by the client; defaults to `false`.

codes.description: A HTTP code (e.g. `404`) or range of codes (e.g. `400-499`)

ttl.description:
Duration a resource lives in the Cloudflare cache.
- positive number - cache for specified duration in seconds

statusCode.description: The status code to use for the redirection.

url.description: The URL to which the page rule should forward.

css.description: Whether CSS should be minified. Valid values are `"on"` or `"off"`.

html.description: Whether HTML should be minified. Valid values are `"on"` or `"off"`.

js.description: Whether Javascript should be minified. Valid values are `"on"` or `"off"`.

mode.description: The type of action to perform. Allowable values are 'simulate', 'ban', 'challenge', 'js_challenge' and 'managed_challenge'.

response.description: Custom content-type and body to return, this overrides the custom error for the zone. This field is not required. Omission will result in default HTML error page. Definition below.

timeout.description: The time in seconds as an integer to perform the mitigation action. This field is required if the `mode` is either `simulate` or `ban`. Must be the same or greater than the period (min: 1, max: 86400).

body.description: The body to return, the content here should conform to the content_type.

contentType.description: The content-type of the body, must be one of: 'text/plain', 'text/xml', 'application/json'.

by.description: If set to 'nat', NAT support will be enabled for rate limiting.

request.description: Matches HTTP requests (from the client to Cloudflare). See definition below.

response.description: Custom content-type and body to return, this overrides the custom error for the zone. This field is not required. Omission will result in default HTML error page. Definition below.

methods.description: HTTP Methods, can be a subset ['POST','PUT'] or all ['\_ALL\_']. Default: ['\_ALL\_'].

schemes.description: HTTP Schemes, can be one ['HTTPS'], both ['HTTP','HTTPS'] or all ['\_ALL\_']. Default: ['\_ALL\_'].

urlPattern.description: The URL pattern to match comprised of the host and path, i.e. example.org/path. Wildcard are expanded to match applicable traffic, query strings are not matched. Use _ for all traffic to your zone. Default: '_'.

headers.description: block is a list of maps with the following attributes:

originTraffic.description: Only count traffic that has come from your origin servers. If true, cached items that Cloudflare serve will not count towards rate limiting. Default: `true`.

statuses.description: HTTP Status codes, can be one [403], many [401,403] or indicate all by not providing this value.

value.description: The (string) value of the record. Either this or `data` must be specified

construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the

cloudflare:index/accessApplication:Acces.description:
Provides a Cloudflare Access Application resource. Access
Applications are used to restrict access to a whole application using an
authorisation gateway managed by Cloudflare.

> It's required that an `account_id` or `zone_id` is provided and in
most cases using either is fine. However, if you're using a scoped
access token, you must provide the argument that matches the token's
scope. For example, an access token that is scoped to the "example.com"
zone needs to use the `zone_id` argument.

accountId.description: The account identifier to target for the resource.

allowedIdps.description: The identity providers selected for the application.

appLauncherVisible.description: Option to show/hide applications in App Launcher.

aud.description: Application Audience (AUD) Tag of the application.

autoRedirectToIdentity.description: Option to skip identity provider selection if only one is configured in `allowed_idps`.

corsHeaders.description: CORS configuration for the Access Application. See below for reference structure.

customDenyMessage.description: Option that returns a custom error message when a user is denied access to the application.

customDenyUrl.description: Option that redirects to a custom URL when a user is denied access to the application.

domain.description: The complete URL of the asset you wish to put Cloudflare Access in front of. Can include subdomains or paths. Or both.

enableBindingCookie.description:
Option to provide increased security against compromised authorization tokens and CSRF attacks by requiring an
additional "binding" cookie on requests.

httpOnlyCookieAttribute.description: Option to add the `HttpOnly` cookie flag to access tokens.

logoUrl.description: Image URL for the logo shown in the app launcher dashboard.

name.description: Friendly name of the Access Application.

sameSiteCookieAttribute.description: Defines the same-site cookie setting for access tokens. Available values: `none`, `lax`, `strict`

serviceAuth401Redirect.description: Option to return a 401 status code in service authentication rules on failed requests.

sessionDuration.description: How often a user will be forced to re-authorise. Must be in the format `48h` or `2h45m`

skipInterstitial.description: Option to skip the authorization interstitial when using the CLI.

type.description: The application type. Available values: `self_hosted`, `ssh`, `vnc`, `file`

zoneId.description: The zone identifier to target for the resource.

cloudflare:index/accessBookmark:AccessBo.description:
Provides a Cloudflare Access Bookmark resource. Access Bookmark applications are not protected behind Access but are displayed in the App Launcher.

> It's required that an `account_id` or `zone_id` is provided and in
most cases using either is fine. However, if you're using a scoped
access token, you must provide the argument that matches the token's
scope. For example, an access token that is scoped to the "example.com"
zone needs to use the `zone_id` argument.

accountId.description: The account identifier to target for the resource.

appLauncherVisible.description: Option to show/hide the bookmark in the app launcher.

domain.description: The domain of the bookmark application. Can include subdomains, paths, or both.

logoUrl.description: The image URL for the logo shown in the app launcher dashboard.

cloudflare:index/accessCaCertificate:Acc.description:
Cloudflare Access can replace traditional SSH key models with short-lived certificates issued to your users based on the token generated by their Access login.

> It's required that an `account_id` or `zone_id` is provided and in
most cases using either is fine. However, if you're using a scoped
access token, you must provide the argument that matches the token's
scope. For example, an access token that is scoped to the "example.com"
zone needs to use the `zone_id` argument.

applicationId.description: The Access Application ID to associate with the CA certificate.

cloudflare:index/accessGroup:AccessGroup.description:
Provides a Cloudflare Access Group resource. Access Groups are used in conjunction with Access Policies to restrict access to a particular resource based on group membership.

> It's required that an `account_id` or `zone_id` is provided and in
most cases using either is fine. However, if you're using a scoped
access token, you must provide the argument that matches the token's
scope. For example, an access token that is scoped to the "example.com"
zone needs to use the `zone_id` argument.

cloudflare:index/accessIdentityProvider:.description:
Provides a Cloudflare Access Identity Provider resource. Identity Providers are used as an authentication or authorisation source within Access.

> It's required that an `account_id` or `zone_id` is provided and in
most cases using either is fine. However, if you're using a scoped
access token, you must provide the argument that matches the token's
scope. For example, an access token that is scoped to the "example.com"
zone needs to use the `zone_id` argument.

cloudflare:index/accessMutualTlsCertific.description:
Provides a Cloudflare Access Mutual TLS Certificate resource. Mutual TLS authentication ensures that the traffic is secure and trusted in both directions between a client and server and can be used with Access to only allows requests from devices with a corresponding client certificate.

> It's required that an `account_id` or `zone_id` is provided and in
most cases using either is fine. However, if you're using a scoped
access token, you must provide the argument that matches the token's
scope. For example, an access token that is scoped to the "example.com"
zone needs to use the `zone_id` argument.

cloudflare:index/accessPolicy:AccessPoli.description:
Provides a Cloudflare Access Policy resource. Access Policies are used in conjunction with Access Applications to restrict access to a particular resource.

access token, you must provide the argument that matches the token's

zone needs to use the `zone_id` argument.

cloudflare:index/fallbackDomain:Fallback.description:
Provides a Cloudflare Fallback Domain resource. Fallback domains are used to ignore DNS requests to a given list of domains. These DNS requests will be passed back to other DNS servers configured on existing network interfaces on the device.


## Import

Fallback Domains can be imported using the account identifer.

```sh
 $ pulumi import cloudflare:index/fallbackDomain:FallbackDomain example 1d5fdc9e88c8a8c4518b068cd94331fe
```

cloudflare:index/healthcheck:Healthcheck.description:
Standalone Health Checks provide a way to monitor origin servers without needing a Cloudflare Load Balancer.

{{% examples %}}
## Example Usage
{{% example %}}

```typescript
import * as pulumi from "@pulumi/pulumi";
import * as cloudflare from "@pulumi/cloudflare";

// HTTPS Healthcheck
const httpHealthCheck = new cloudflare.Healthcheck("httpHealthCheck", {
    zoneId: _var.cloudflare_zone_id,
    name: "http-health-check",
    description: "example http health check",
    address: "example.com",
    suspended: false,
    checkRegions: [
        "WEU",
        "EEU",
    ],
    type: "HTTPS",
    port: 443,
    method: "GET",
    path: "/health",
    expectedBody: "alive",
    expectedCodes: [
        "2xx",
        "301",
    ],
    followRedirects: true,
    allowInsecure: false,
    headers: [{
        header: "Host",
        values: ["example.com"],
    }],
    timeout: 10,
    retries: 2,
    interval: 60,
    consecutiveFails: 3,
    consecutiveSuccesses: 2,
});
// TCP Healthcheck
const tcpHealthCheck = new cloudflare.Healthcheck("tcpHealthCheck", {
    zoneId: _var.cloudflare_zone_id,
    name: "tcp-health-check",
    description: "example tcp health check",
    address: "example.com",
    suspended: false,
    checkRegions: [
        "WEU",
        "EEU",
    ],
    type: "TCP",
    port: 22,
    method: "connection_established",
    timeout: 10,
    retries: 2,
    interval: 60,
    consecutiveFails: 3,
    consecutiveSuccesses: 2,
});
```
```python
import pulumi
import pulumi_cloudflare as cloudflare

# HTTPS Healthcheck
http_health_check = cloudflare.Healthcheck("httpHealthCheck",
    zone_id=var["cloudflare_zone_id"],

    check_regions=[
        "WEU",

    ],
    type="HTTPS",
    port=443,
    method="GET",
    path="/health",
    expected_body="alive",
    expected_codes=[
        "2xx",
        "301",
    ],
    follow_redirects=True,
    allow_insecure=False,
    headers=[cloudflare.HealthcheckHeaderArgs(
        header="Host",
        values=["example.com"],
    )],
    timeout=10,
    retries=2,
    interval=60,
    consecutive_fails=3,
    consecutive_successes=2)
# TCP Healthcheck
tcp_health_check = cloudflare.Healthcheck("tcpHealthCheck",
    zone_id=var["cloudflare_zone_id"],
    name="tcp-health-check",
    description="example tcp health check",
    address="example.com",
    suspended=False,
    check_regions=[
        "WEU",
        "EEU",
    ],
    type="TCP",
    port=22,
    method="connection_established",
    timeout=10,
    retries=2,
    interval=60,
    consecutive_fails=3,
    consecutive_successes=2)
```

```go
package main

import (
	"github.com/pulumi/pulumi-cloudflare/sdk/v4/go/cloudflare"
	"github.com/pulumi/pulumi/sdk/v3/go/pulumi"
)

func main() {
	pulumi.Run(func(ctx *pulumi.Context) error {
		_, err := cloudflare.NewHealthcheck(ctx, "httpHealthCheck", &cloudflare.HealthcheckArgs{
			ZoneId:      pulumi.Any(_var.Cloudflare_zone_id),
			Name:        pulumi.String("http-health-check"),
			Description: pulumi.String("example http health check"),
			Address:     pulumi.String("example.com"),
			Suspended:   pulumi.Bool(false),
			CheckRegions: pulumi.StringArray{
				pulumi.String("WEU"),
				pulumi.String("EEU"),
			},
			Type:         pulumi.String("HTTPS"),
			Port:         pulumi.Int(443),
			Method:       pulumi.String("GET"),
			Path:         pulumi.String("/health"),
			ExpectedBody: pulumi.String("alive"),
			ExpectedCodes: pulumi.StringArray{
				pulumi.String("2xx"),
				pulumi.String("301"),
			},
			FollowRedirects: pulumi.Bool(true),
			AllowInsecure:   pulumi.Bool(false),
			Headers: HealthcheckHeaderArray{
				&HealthcheckHeaderArgs{
					Header: pulumi.String("Host"),
					Values: pulumi.StringArray{
						pulumi.String("example.com"),
					},
				},
			},
			Timeout:              pulumi.Int(10),
			Retries:              pulumi.Int(2),
			Interval:             pulumi.Int(60),
			ConsecutiveFails:     pulumi.Int(3),
			ConsecutiveSuccesses: pulumi.Int(2),
		})
		if err != nil {
			return err
		}
		_, err = cloudflare.NewHealthcheck(ctx, "tcpHealthCheck", &cloudflare.HealthcheckArgs{
			ZoneId:      pulumi.Any(_var.Cloudflare_zone_id),
			Name:        pulumi.String("tcp-health-check"),
			Description: pulumi.String("example tcp health check"),
			Address:     pulumi.String("example.com"),
			Suspended:   pulumi.Bool(false),
			CheckRegions: pulumi.StringArray{
				pulumi.String("WEU"),
				pulumi.String("EEU"),
			},
			Type:                 pulumi.String("TCP"),
			Port:                 pulumi.Int(22),
			Method:               pulumi.String("connection_established"),
			Timeout:              pulumi.Int(10),
			Retries:              pulumi.Int(2),
			Interval:             pulumi.Int(60),
			ConsecutiveFails:     pulumi.Int(3),
			ConsecutiveSuccesses: pulumi.Int(2),
		})
		if err != nil {
			return err
		}
		return nil
	})
}
```

## Import

# Use the Zone ID and Healthcheck ID to import.

```sh
 $ pulumi import cloudflare:index/healthcheck:Healthcheck example <zone_id>/<healthcheck_id>
```

address.description: The hostname or IP address of the origin server to run health checks on.

allowInsecure.description: Do not validate the certificate when the health check uses HTTPS.

checkRegions.description:
A list of regions from which to run health checks. If not set, Cloudflare will pick a default region. Available values:
`WNAM`, `ENAM`, `WEU`, `EEU`, `NSAM`, `SSAM`, `OC`, `ME`, `NAF`, `SAF`, `IN`, `SEAS`, `NEAS`, `ALL_REGIONS`

consecutiveFails.description: The number of consecutive fails required from a health check before changing the health to unhealthy.

consecutiveSuccesses.description: The number of consecutive successes required from a health check before changing the health to healthy.

description.description: A human-readable description of the health check.

expectedBody.description:
A case-insensitive sub-string to look for in the response body. If this string is not found the origin will be marked as
unhealthy.

expectedCodes.description:
The expected HTTP response codes (e.g. '200') or code ranges (e.g. '2xx' for all codes starting with 2) of the health
check.

followRedirects.description: Follow redirects if the origin returns a 3xx status code.

headers.description:
The HTTP request headers to send in the health check. It is recommended you set a Host header by default. The User-Agent
header cannot be overridden.

interval.description:
The interval between each health check. Shorter intervals may give quicker notifications if the origin status changes,
but will increase the load on the origin as we check from multiple locations.

method.description: The HTTP method to use for the health check. Available values: `connection_established`, `GET`, `HEAD`

name.description: A short name to identify the health check. Only alphanumeric characters, hyphens, and underscores are allowed.

notificationEmailAddresses.description: A list of email addresses we want to send the notifications to. Deprecated, use cloudflare_notification_policy instead.

notificationSuspended.description: Whether the notifications are suspended or not. Useful for maintenance periods.

path.description: The endpoint path to health check against.

port.description: Port number to connect to for the health check.

retries.description:
The number of retries to attempt in case of a timeout before marking the origin as unhealthy. Retries are attempted
immediately.

suspended.description: If suspended, no health checks are sent to the origin.

timeout.description: The timeout (in seconds) before marking the health check as failed.

type.description: The protocol to use for the health check. Available values: `TCP`, `HTTP`, `HTTPS`

The HTTP request headers to send in the health check. It is recommended you set a Host header by default. The User-Agent
header cannot be overridden.

interval.description:
The interval between each health check. Shorter intervals may give quicker notifications if the origin status changes,
but will increase the load on the origin as we check from multiple locations.

method.description: The HTTP method to use for the health check. Available values: `connection_established`, `GET`, `HEAD`

name.description: A short name to identify the health check. Only alphanumeric characters, hyphens, and underscores are allowed.

notificationEmailAddresses.description: A list of email addresses we want to send the notifications to. Deprecated, use cloudflare_notification_policy instead.

notificationSuspended.description: Whether the notifications are suspended or not. Useful for maintenance periods.

path.description: The endpoint path to health check against.

port.description: Port number to connect to for the health check.

retries.description:
The number of retries to attempt in case of a timeout before marking the origin as unhealthy. Retries are attempted
immediately.

suspended.description: If suspended, no health checks are sent to the origin.

timeout.description: The timeout (in seconds) before marking the health check as failed.

type.description: The protocol to use for the health check. Available values: `TCP`, `HTTP`, `HTTPS`

cloudflare:index/logpushJob:LogpushJob.description:
## Import

# Import an account-scoped job.

```sh
 $ pulumi import cloudflare:index/logpushJob:LogpushJob example account/<account_id>/<job_id>
```

 # Import a zone-scoped job.

```sh
 $ pulumi import cloudflare:index/logpushJob:LogpushJob example zone/<zone_id>/<job_id>
```

accountId.description: The account identifier to target for the resource.

dataset.description:
Uniquely identifies a resource (such as an s3 bucket) where data will be pushed. Additional configuration parameters
supported by the destination may be included. See [Logpush destination
documentation](https://developers.cloudflare.com/logs/reference/logpush-api-configuration#destination). Available
values: `firewall_events`, `http_requests`, `spectrum_events`, `nel_reports`, `audit_logs`, `gateway_dns`,
`gateway_http`, `gateway_network`, `dns_logs`, `network_analytics_logs`

destinationConf.description:
Uniquely identifies a resource (such as an s3 bucket) where data will be pushed. Additional configuration parameters
supported by the destination may be included. See [Logpush destination
documentation](https://developers.cloudflare.com/logs/reference/logpush-api-configuration#destination).

enabled.description: Whether to enable the job.

filter.description:
Use filters to select the events to include and/or remove from your logs. For more information, refer to
[Filters](https://developers.cloudflare.com/logs/reference/logpush-api-configuration/filters/).

frequency.description:
A higher frequency will result in logs being pushed on faster with smaller files. `low` frequency will push logs less
often with larger files. Available values: `high`, `low`

action.description: The action to be performed when the threshold of matched traffic within the period defined is exceeded.

bypassUrlPatterns.description: URLs matching the patterns specified here will be excluded from rate limiting.

correlate.description: Determines how rate limiting is applied. By default if not specified, rate limiting applies to the clients IP address.

description.description: A note that you can use to describe the reason for a rate limit. This value is sanitized and all tags are removed.

disabled.description: Whether this ratelimit is currently disabled. Default: `false`.

match.description: Determines which traffic the rate limit counts towards the threshold. By default matches all traffic in the zone. See definition below.

period.description: The time in seconds to count matching traffic. If the count exceeds threshold within this period the action will be performed (min: 1, max: 86,400).

threshold.description: The threshold that triggers the rate limit mitigations, combine with period. i.e. threshold per period (min: 2, max: 1,000,000).

zoneId.description: The DNS zone ID to apply rate limiting to.

ipFirewall.description: Enables the IP Firewall for this application. Defaults to `true`.

originDns.description: A destination DNS addresses to the origin. Fields documented below.

protocol.description: The port configuration at Cloudflares edge. e.g. `tcp/22`.

proxyProtocol.description: Enables a proxy protocol to the origin. Valid values are: `off`, `v1`, `v2`, and `simple`. Defaults to `off`.

tls.description: TLS configuration option for Cloudflare to connect to your origin. Valid values are: `off`, `flexible`, `full` and `strict`. Defaults to `off`.

trafficType.description: Sets application type. Valid values are: `direct`, `http`, `https`. Defaults to `direct`.
